title: Aurizon's Queensland coal haulage volumes drop
text:
Aurizon's Queensland coal haulage volumes have weakened, dropping 4 per cent in the September quarter despite record state exports earlier this year.

Aurizon hauled 36.6 million tonnes of coal in Queensland in the three months ended September 30, compared with 38 million tonnes a year earlier and 39.5 million tonnes in the June quarter.

The rail group said haulage demand from a top customer, the BHP Mitsubishi Alliance, had been lower than expected because of the mining group undertaking wash plant maintenance while other customers had experienced "production constraints."

"Volumes are forecast to increase during the remainder of the year," Aurizon said. Queensland coal exports have been strong in 2019, with a record 21.4 million tonnes exported in June.

Including coal haulage volumes in NSW, which rose 14 per cent to 16.2 million tonnes in the September quarter compared with a year earlier because of a new MACH Energy contract, Aurizon's overall coal haulage volumes climbed 1 per cent.

Bulk haulage volumes, which include iron ore, also rose 1 per cent to 11.6 million tonnes.
description: The rail group blamed production constraints for a 4 per cent fall in the September quarter.
